title: Massive Shake-up For Battlefield Franchise Revealed - Kinda Funny Games Daily 12.02.21
description:
Go to http://purple.com/GAMES10 and use promo code GAMES10 to get 10% off any order of $200 or more!

Download the DraftKings app NOW and use promo code KINDAFUNNY to play free for millions.

Go to http://liquidiv.com and use code KFGD at checkout to get 25% off!

Tim and Tam cover the big things happening at EA with Battlefield, as well as the cancelled Need for Speed TV show and more.

Time Stamps - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:05:20 - Housekeeping
There’s a new Kinda Funny Gamescast up right now featuring Blessing, Tim Gettys, and special guest Sancho West. It’s Blessing giving my review of Solar Ash and then the crew spend some time alking about Halo eSports. Obviously, there is a big old tangent about Last of Us Factions. It’s a must listen episode that’s available over on youtube.com/kindafunnygames and podcast services around the globe.
Thank you to our Patreon Producers: Pranksy &  Black Jack
The Roper Report   -
00:06:40 - Battlefield Franchise Undergoes Major Shake-Up – GameSpot, Eddie Makuch
00:17:20 - The Original Titanfall Is No Longer Available For Sale, But The "Universe Will Continue" -- GameSpot, Cameron Koch
00:21:45 - Nvidia Is Releasing A New 12GB RTX 2060 To Address Shortages -- GameSpot, Hayley Williams
00:27:00 -  Ad
00:30:15 -  Cancelled Need For Speed TV Show Details Revealed – GameSpot, Darryn Bonthuys
00:35:00 -  -  The Matrix Awakens; An Unreal Engine 5 Experience has appeared in the PSN backend – Reddit
00:38:05 - Twenty percent of Xbox Cloud Gaming players only use touch controls - Tom Warren, The Verge
 00:42:40 - Out today
00:48:20 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts: Janet & Rebekah Valentine

2019. the re-release is intended to give more decently priced options for gamers who may be struggling to find affordable cards even on the secondary secondary market or the second-hand market it's likely the rtx 2060 was originally chosen to be re-released as it doesn't contain the same components rumored to be causing manufacturing bottlenecks for newer hardware nvidia has said that the new 2060 card should be available starting december 7th though no indication on pricing has been given thus far in a statement the company just indicated that the new cards would be most likely to cost uh because more than the rtx 2060s original release price of 349. it's a premium version of the rtx 2060 six gigabyte and we expect it the price to reflect that the spokesperson said the specs for the new founders edition rtx 2060 can be found uh online as well as boosted video ram the card looks to have a few other slight improvements on the 2019 version including a higher base clock speed and
